definition: start of the year
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: And before this, New Year's day is always the first day of the lunar year means.
sentences.chinese: 而在此之前，元旦一直是指农历岁首第一天的。

sentences.english: In contemporary, New Year's day, refers to the Christian era at the first day.
sentences.chinese: 在当代，元旦指公元纪年的岁首第一天。

sentences.english: Since then, people took this day as.
sentences.chinese: 从此，人们就把这一天当作岁首。

definition: the traditional Chinese lunar calendar
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
a new year begins (idiom)
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
first month of the lunar year
Gregorian calendar/solar calendar
first day of the lunar month
Gregorian calendar/Western calendar
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
almanac
intercalary month in the lunar calendar/leap month
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
Gregorian calendar/solar calendar
calendar science/calendar system
variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
usher out the old, greet the new/esp. to see in the New Year
